newsitem.title: USA: Cisco buys networking business, sees charge.
newsitem.headline: Cisco buys networking business, sees charge.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc. said Monday it signed a definitive agreement to buy the high-speed networking business of privately held Integrated Network Corp. for $108 million in cash.
Integrated's Dagaz xDSL technology allows Internet service providers to transmit high-speed data, video and voice service quickly and easily over ordinary telephone lines.

As part of the purchase of Integrated's Dagaz xDSL unit, Cisco also agreed to assume the unit's stock option plan, with about 230,000 shares of Cisco stock, which the company said are worth about $16.5 million.
Cisco said it expected to take an after-tax charge of between $53.5 million and $73.6 million in the next quarter in connection with the acquisition.
The company said Cisco said it expected the transaction to have a neutral impact on its earnings in the first year and to addd to profits thereafter.
Cisco's stock lost $1.375 to $78.3125 in early trading on the Nasdaq market.
